data.title: West Asian Games (Qatar) 2005
data.text:
West Asian Games (Qatar) 2005 - Details

Group A Dec 1 Qatar 2-1 Kuwait [Sahim bin Hamad, Qatar SC Stadium] Khalfan Ibrahim Al-Khalfan 36, Ali Hassan Yahya Afif 43; Khalid Farid Al-Abdullah (o.g.) 74 Qatar: Ghaith Jumah Al-Mohannadi, Sultan Bilal, Ali Solaiman, Tahir Zakaria, Faisal Ali Al-Shuaibi, Ali Hassan Yahya Afif, Mohammed Abdul-Raab Al-Yazidi, Khalid Fareed Al-Abdullah (Yusef Ahmed Ali 80'), Khalfan Ibrahim Al-Khalfan (Johar Abdulaziz Al-Kaabi 73'), Hamoud Abdullah Al-Yazidi [c], Abdullah Hassen Shamlan (Abdullah Mohammed Al-Kuwari 55'). Coach: Roberto Landi (Italy) Kuwait: Khaled Al-Rashidi [c], Faisal Dashti, Hussein Al-Mosawi (Abdul-Rahman Al-Awadhi 77'), Abdul-Aziz Al-Mashan Al-Enezi, Mashari Al-Azmi (Abdul-Rahman Awad Al-Sarbal 55'), Abdullah Al-Haddad, Amer Al-Matouk Al-Fadhel, Jarrah Al-Zuhair, Mohammed Rashid Sanad, Ahmed Abdel-Ghafour (Bader Al-Thafeeri 45'), Ali Al-Mashmoum. Coach: Manuel Amoros (France) Referee: Jaafar Alawi Jawad Mahfous (Bahrain) Linesmen: Yusuf Abdullah Qambar Al-Wazeer (Bahrain) & Ibrahim Al-Debasi (Saudi Arabia) Fourth Official: Abdullah Mohammed Masoud Al-Hilali (Oman) Cautions: Tahir Zakaria 14, Mohammed Sanad 19, Faisal Ali Al-Shuaibi 26, Ghaith Juma Al-Mohannadi 46, Abdul-Aziz Mashan Al-Enezi 62, Tahir Zakaria 71, Mohammed Abdul-Raab Al-Yazidi 76, Abdullah Mohammed Al-Kuwari 87 Sending-Off: Tahir Zakaria 71. Dec 3 Iran 4-0 Kuwait [Sahim bin Hamad, Qatar SC Stadium] Arash Borhani 58, 68, Faisal Dashti (o.g.) 59, Mehrdad Oladi Ghadikolaei 72 Iran: Hassan Rodbarian, Jalal Akbari Kelishadi (Mazyar Zare Eshghdoost 78), Mohsen Arzani, Sayed Jalal Hosseini Khoshkebejari, Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang, Javad Nekounam [c], Masaud Soleimani Shojaei, Andranik Timorian Samarani, Arashi Borhani (Mehrdad Oladi Ghadikolaei 71), Gholamreza Enayati (Saeid Daghighi Masouleh 69), Behshad Ahrandjani. Coach: René Simões Rodrigues (Brazil) Kuwait: Khaled Al-Rashidi [c], Faisal Dashti, Husain Al-Mosawi, Abdul-Aziz Al-Mashan Al-Enezi, Mashari Al-Azmi, Abdullah Al-Haddad (Abdullah Dhary 79), Bader Al-Thafeeri, Amer Al-Matouk Al-Fadhel, Abdul-Razzaq Al-Buti (Abdul-Rahman Al-Awadhi 63), Jarrah Al-Zuhair, Mohammed Rashid Sanad, Ali Al-Mashmoum (Bader Abdullah 72). Coach: Manuel Amoros (France) Referee: Mamdouh Al-Mirdas (Saudi Arabia) Linesmen: Ibrahim Al-Debasi (Saudi Arabia) & Ali Hassan Al-Boenain (Qatar) Fourth Official: Mohsen Basma (Syria) Cautions: Jalal Akbari Kelishadi 18, Abdullah Al-Haddad 27, Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang 53, Behshad Ahrandjani 70, Mohsen Arzani 86. Dec 5 Iran 4-1 Qatar [Sahim bin Hamad, Qatar SC Stadium] Javad Nekonam 6, Mohsen Arzani 33, Behshad Ahrandjani 59, Pejman Montazeri 76; Khalfan Ibrahim Al-Khalfan 10 Iran: Vahid Talebloo, Jalal Akbari Kelishadi, Mohsen Arzani, Sayed Jalal Hosseini Khoshkebejari, Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang, Javad Nekounam [c], Masaud Soleimani Shojaei, Andranik Timorian Samarani, Mehrdad Oladi Ghadikolaei (Pejman Montazeri 46) Gholamreza Enayati (Saeid Daghighi Masouleh 75), Behshad Ahrandjani (Mazyar Zare Eshghdoost 60). Coach: René Simões Rodrigues (Brazil) Qatar: Ghaith Jumah Al-Mohannadi, Sultan Bilal (Khalid Fareed Al-Abdullah 61), Ali Solaiman, Johar Abdulaziz Al-Kaabi, Faisal Ali Al-Shuaibi, Ali Hassan Yahya Afif, Mohammed Abdul-Raab Al-Yazidi (Abdullah Mohammed Al-Kuwari 82), Khalfan Ibrahim Al-Khalfan, Hamoud Abdullah Al-Yazidi [c], Abdullah Hassen Shamlan (Ahmed Khamis 75), Yusef Ahmed Ali. Coach: Roberto Landi (Italy) Referee: Mohsen Basma (Syria) Linesmen: Ibrahim Al-Debasi (Saudi Arabia) & Mohammed Attal (Syria) Fourth Official: Mamdouh Al-Mirdas (Saudi Arabia) Cautions: Johar Abdull-Aziz Al-Kaabi 5, Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang 9, Andranik Timorian Samarani 42, Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang 45, Hamoud Abdullah Al-Yazidi 64, Ahmed Khamis 86. Sending Off: Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang 45 P W D L F A Pts Iran 2 2 0 0 8 1 6 Qatar 2 1 0 1 3 5 3 Kuwait 2 0 0 2 1 6 0 Group B Dec 1 Iraq 4-0 Palestine [Ahmed Bin Ali, Al-Rayyan SC Stadium] Razzaq Farhan 4, Hawar Mulla-Mohammed 56, Loay Salah 73, Ahmed Salah 86 Iraq: Nour Sabri, Samal Saeed, Ali Hussein Rahema, Yassir Raad, Haidar Abdul-Amir, Qusai Munir (Ahmed Salah 74'), Wisam Zaki (Haitham Kadhim 57'), Nashat Akram, Hawar Mulla Mohammed, Emad Mohammed, Razzaq Farhan [c] (Loay Salah 65') . Coach: Akram Salman Ahmed Palestine: Ramzi Saleh; Ismail Al-Amour, Ehab Abu Jazar, Saeb Jendeya [c], Hamada Eshbeir; Fadi Salem, Mohanad Omar (Edgardo Abdala 35'), Ibrahim Al-Sweiraki, Tayser Amer (Imad Zatara 63'); Ahmed Keshkesh (Roberto Kettlun 35'), Fahad Attal. Coach: Azmi Nassar Referee: Abdullah Mohad Al-Buloushi (Qatar) Linesmen: Ali Hassan Al-Boenain (Qatar) & Abdullah Salim Khalfan Al-Amouri (Oman) Fourth Official: Mohsen Basma (Syria) Cautions: Mohanad Omar 18, Tayser Amer 26, Nashat Akram 74. Dec 3 Saudi Arabia 2-0 Palestine [Ahmed Bin Ali, Al-Rayyan SC Stadium] Ahmed Al-Suwailh 18, Eissa Al-Mahyani 22 Saudi Arabia: Saeed Marzouq Al-Harbi, Suliman Amedu, Naif Ali Al-Qadi (Ahmed Al-Bahri 46), Issa Al-Mahyani (Mohammed Al-Anbar 60), Saod Al-Kaebari, Mohammed Masoud Al-Mowallad, Khalid Aziz Al-Thaker (Sahib Jassim Al-Abdullah 45), Nawaf Al-Temyat [c], Ahmed Al-Suwailh, Alaa Al-Kwykbi. Coach: Gabriel Calderon (Argentina) Palestine: Ramzi Saleh; Ismail Al-Amour (Fadi Salem 25), Majid Abu Seidu, Fadi Dwaik (Ehab Abu Jazar 45), Saeb Jendeya [c], Hamada Eshbeir; Edgardo Abdala, Ibrahim Al-Sweiraki, Tayser Amer (Fadi Al-Ali 66), Imad Zatara, Roberto Kettlun. Coach: Azmi Nassar Referee: Nassir Al-Enezi (Kuwait) Linesmen: Sulaiman Al-Shammari (Kuwait) & Mohammed Attal (Syria) Fourth Official: Abdul-Rahman Abdou (Qatar) Cautions: Imad Zatara 67, Ehab Abu Jazar 68, Hamada Eshbeir 76. Dec 5 Iraq 5-1 Saudi Arabia [Ahmed Bin Ali, Al-Rayyan SC Stadium] Haidar Abdul-Amir 8, Emad Mohammed 19, Nashat Akram 30, Younis Mahmoud 51, 78; Naif Ali Al-Qadhi 53 Iraq: Nour Sabri, Samal Saeed, Ali Hussein Rahema, Yassir Raad, Haidar Abdul-Amir, Qusai Munir, Haitham Kadhim (Safwan Abdul-Ghani 83'), Nashat Akram, Hawar Mulla Mohammed, Emad Mohammed (Loay Salah 68'), Razzaq Farhan [c] (Younis Mahmoud 46'), Coach: Akram Salman Ahmed Saudi Arabia Assaf Al-Qarni; Walid Jahdali, Naif Ali Al-Qadhi [c], Kamil Al-Mousa (Nawaf Al-Temyat 46'), Ahmed Al-Bahri; Taiseer Al-Jassam, Khalid Aziz Al-Thaker, Sahib Jassim Al-Abdullah (Mohammed Masoud Al-Mowallad 59'), Saad Ali Al-Aboud; Ahmed Al-Suwailh, Eissa Al-Mahyani (Mohammed Al-Anbar 46'). Coach: Gabriel Humberto Calderón Metralla (Argentina) Referee: Abdullah Mohammed Masoud Al-Hilali (Oman) Linesmen: Sulaiman Al-Shammari (Kuwait) & Abdullah Salim Khalfan Al-Amouri (Oman) Fourth Official: Nassir Al-Enezi (Kuwait) Cautions: Sahib Jassim Al-Abdullah 33', Naif Ali Al-Qadhi 45', Ali Hussein Rahema 59', Younis Mahmoud 80', Qusai Munir 88'. P W D L F A Pts Iraq 2 2 0 0 9 1 6 Saudi Arabia 2 1 0 1 3 5 3 Palestine 2 0 0 2 0 6 0 Group C Dec 3 Oman 1-3 Syria [Thani Al-Jassim, Al-Gharrafa SC Stadium] Hassan Zahir Rajab Al-Maghni 35; Yahya Rashid 41, Rafat Mohammed 68, Moutasem Alaya 81 Oman: Badar Juma, Ashraf Eid Taysir, Hussain Mustahail [c], Sultan Mohamed Said, Hassan Zahir Rajab Al-Maghni, Yousuf Shaban Mubarak Al-Busaidi, Ahmed Salim Ahmed (Ghanim Obaid Obaidan 89'), Ahmed Awadh Bashir (Ismail Sulaiman Ashoor 77'), Mohamed Mubarak Suwaid, Abdullah Said, Mohammed Hamed Hidaib (Hamdi Houbes 65') Coach: Srecko Juricic (Croatia) Syria: Redwan Azhar, Rafat Mohammed [c], Majd Homsi (Ali Diab 43'), Adeb Barakat, Jehad Al-Hussein (Mahmoud Amena 73'), Majed Al-Haj, Anas Al-Khoja (Abdel-Kader Dakka 82'), Yahya Al-Rashid, Ziyad Shaabo, Moutasim Alaya, Firas Ismail. Coach: Milosav Radenovic (Serbia & Montenegro) Referee: Hai Tan (China) Linesmen: Wei Han (China) & Davoud Rafatisajedi (Iran) Fourth Official: Mohsen Torki (Iran) Cautions: Rafat Mohammed 8, Majd Homsi 22, Yahya Rashid 88. Note: The match was scheduled for December 1, however the game was postponed after the Omani and Syrian teams turned up at different venues for their opening game. Organisers laid the blame on the driver of the Syrian team bus who took the team to the Rayyan Stadium (where Iraq was playing Palestine) while the Omani team were getting ready at the Gharrafa Club where the match was supposed to be played. The match was later rescheduled for 2115 local time the same day, but even that didn't materialise as the teams decided against playing. The change meant that Syria had to play two matches in two days. Dec 4 Bahrain 2-2 Syria [Thani Al-Jassim, Al-Gharrafa Stadium] Hamad Rakah Humoud 70, Ismail Abdul-Latif Hassan 83; Mahmoud Amena 60, Jehad Al-Hussein 66 Bahrain: Sayed Mohammed Jaffar; Hussein Mohammed [c], Abdullah Al-Marzouq, Ghazi Majid Al-Kuwari (Abdul-Rahman Mubarak Zaid 78), Hamad Rakah Humoud, Abdullah Adnan Al-Dakhil, Saleh Ahmed Farhan , Salman Hussein Maki, Fawzi Mubarak Aaish, Ahmed Hassan Talib (Mahmoud Abbas Hassan 86), Ahmed Ibrahim Al-Huiairi (Ismail Abdul-Latif Hassan 63). Coach: Luka Peruzovic (Croatia/Belgium) Syria: Redwan Azhar, Rafat Mohammed [c], Ali Diab, Adeb Barakat, Jehad Al-Hussein (Anas Al-Khoja 88'), Mahmoud Amena (Majed Al-Haj 82), Mohammed Istanbuli, Yahya Rashid, Ziyad Shaabo, Moutasim Alaya (Abdel-Kader Dakka 90'), Firas Ismail. Coach: Milosav Radenovic (Serbia & Montenegro) Referee: Hazim Issa (Iraq) Linesmen: Sabhan Mohammed (Iraq) & Anan Al-Rawagh (Palestine) Fourth Official: Mahmoud Al-Jaish (Palestine) Cautions: Saleh Ahmed Farhan 17, Mahmoud Amena 27, Abdullah Adnan Al-Dakhil 38 Dec 6 Bahrain 2-2 Oman [Thani Al-Jassim, Al-Gharrafa Stadium] Hassan Zahir Rajab 23, Mohammed Hussein 83; Salman Hussein Maki 66, Mohammed Ahmed Al-Lawati 82 Bahrain: Sayed Mohammed Jaffar; Mohammed Hussein [c], Abdullah Al-Marzouq, Hamad Rakah Humoud, Mahmoud Abbas Hassan (Ahmed Hassan Talib 46), Ismail Abdul-Latif Hassan (Abdullah Adnan Al-Dakhil 68), Abdul-Rahman Mubarak Zaid (Duaij Nassir Abdullah 46), Jassim Mohammed Al-Chuban, Saleh Ahmed Farhan, Salman Hussein Maki, Fawzi Mubarak Aaish. Coach: Luka Peruzovic (Croatia/Belgium) Oman: Ali Talib Salman Al-Ajmi, Ashraf Eid Taysir, Hussein Mustahail [c], Sultan Mohammed Said Al-Touqi, Hassan Zahir Rajab Al-Maghni (Nabil Ashour 86), Yousef Shaaban Al-Busaidi, Ahmed Salim Ahmed, Mohamed Hamid Hidaib Al-Mukhaini (Mohammed Ahmed Taqi Al-Lawati 80), Ahmed Awadh Al-Marzouq, Mohammed Mubarak Al-Hinai (Hassan Nasib Al-Mukhaini 88), Abdullah Said Kamouna. Coach: Srecko Juricic (Croatia) Referee: Rosdi Shaharul (Malaysia) Linesmen: Sabhan Mohammed (Iraq) & Anan Al-Rawagh (Palestine) Fourth Official: Hazim Issa (Iraq) Cautions: Sultan Mohammed Said Al-Touqi 18, Abdul-Rahman Mubarak Zaid 21, Yousef Shaaban Al-Busaidi 75, Yousef Shaaban Al-Busaidi 85, Ahmed Salim Ahmed Bait Said 89, Hussein Mustahail 93. Sending-Off: Yousef Shaaban Al-Busaidi 85 P W D L F A Pts Syria 2 1 1 0 5 3 4 Bahrain 2 0 2 0 4 4 2 Oman 2 0 1 1 3 5 1 Semifinals Dec 8 Iraq 2-0 Saudi Arabia [Sahim Bin Hamed, Qatar Sports Club Stadium] Loay Salah 33, Razzaq Farhan 85 Iraq: Nour Sabri, Samal Saeed, Ali Hussein Rahema, Yassir Raad, Haidar Abdul-Amir, Qusai Munir, Haitham Kadhim (Ahmed Salah 56), Nashat Akram, Hawar Mulla Mohammed, Emad Mohammed [c] (Haidar Abdul-Razzaq 86), Loay Salah (Razzaq Farhan 69). Coach: Akram Salman Ahmed Saudi Arabia: Saeed Marzouq Al-Harbi; Walid Abdrabh Jahdali, Ahmed Al-Bahri, Suliman Amedu, Naif Ali Al-Qadhi; Mohsen Al-Qarni (Saad Ali Al-Aboud 74'), Taiseer Jaber Al-Jassam, Mohammed Masoud Al-Mowallad (Eissa Al-Mahyani 82'), Khalid Aziz Al-Thaker, Nawaf Al-Temyat [c]; Mohammed Al-Anbar (Ahmed Al-Suwailh 78'). Coach: Gabriel Humberto Calderón Metralla (Argentina) Referee: Hai Tan (China) Linesmen: Wei Han (China) & Abdullah Salim Khalfan Al-Amouri (Oman) Fourth Official: Abdullah Mohammed Masoud Al-Hilali (Oman) Cautions: Qusai Munir 27, Hawar Mulla Mohammed 59, Naif Ali Al-Qadhi 62, Suliman Amedu 75, Mohammed Masaud Al-Mowallad 77, Nour Sabri 87, Nashat Akram 92. Note: Saudi beat Qatar to qualify for the semi-finals on a toss of a coin! Iran 0-0 Syria [Sahim Bin Hamed, Qatar Sports Club Stadium] Iran: Hassan Rodbarian, Jalal Akbar Kelishadi, Seyed Jalal Hosseini Khoshkebejari, Javad Nekounam [c], Masoud Soleimani Shojaei, Andranik Timorian Samarani, Arash Borhani, Gholamreza Enayati, Pejman Montazeri, Behshad Ahrandjani (Saied Daghighi Masouleh 77), Mazyar Zare Eshghdoost. Coach: René Simões Rodrigues (Brazil) Syria: Redwan Azhar, Rafat Mohammed [c], Adeb Barakat (Abdel-Kader Dakka 14), Jehad Al-Hussein, Mahmoud Amena, Mohammed Istanbuli (Ali Diab 91), Majed Al-Haj, Anas Al-Khoja, Yahya Al-Rashid (Moutasim Alaya 75), Ziyad Shaabo, Firas Ismail. Coach: Milosav Radenovic (Serbia & Montenegro) Referee: Abdul-Rahman Abdou (Qatar) Linesmen: Ali Hassan Al-Boenain (Qatar), Yusuf Abdullah Qambar Al-Wazeer (Bahrain) Fourth Official: Nassir Al-Enezi (Kuwait) Cautions: Gholamreza Enayati 32, Firas Ismail 46, Rafat Mohammed 50, Saied Daghighi Masouleh 80, Majed Al-Haj 86, Rafat Mohammed 88, Anas Al-Khoja 92, Hassan Rodbarian 92. Sending-Off: Rafat Mohammed 88 Syria win 4-1 on penalties Mahmoud Amena 1-0 Javad Nekonam Jehad Al-Hussein 2-1 Mazyar Zare Eshghdoost Ziyad Shaabo 3-1 Saied Daghighi Masouleh Abdel-Kader Dakka 4-1 Note: Mahmoud Amena had the first penalty saved by Iran goalkeeper Hassan Rodbarian, but was allowed to retake it because the goalkeeper had moved off his line before it was kicked. Second time around he made no mistake and put his team 1-0 ahead. Third Place Match Dec 10 Saudi Arabia 1-2 Iran [Sahim Bin Hamed, Qatar Sports Club Stadium] Sahib Jassim Al-Abdullah 8; Arash Borhani 2, 4 Saudi Arabia: Saeed Marzouq Al-Harbi; Suliman Amedu, Naif Ali Al-Qadhi, Ahmed Al-Bahri, Kamil Saddiq Al-Mousa; Taiseer Jaber Al-Jassam, Khalid Aziz Al-Thaker (Mohsen Al-Qarni 66), Saheb Jassim Al-Abdullah, Nawaf Al-Temyat [c] (Mohammed Masaud Al-Mowallad 58), Ahmed Al-Suwailh, Faisal Nassir Bin Sultan (Mohammed Al-Anbar 82). Coach: Gabriel Humberto Calderón Metralla (Argentina) Iran: Vahid Talebloo; Jalal Akbari Kelishadi, Jalal Hosseini Khoshkebejari, Pejman Montazeri, Javad Nekounam [c], Masaud Soleimani Shojaei, Andranik Timorian Samarani, Arash Borhani (Sepehr Heydari Chaharlang 80), Gholamreza Enayati (Mehrdad Oladi Ghadikolaei 71), Behshad Ahrandjani (Mohammed Nori 56), Mazyar Zare Eshghdoost Coach: René Simões Rodrigues (Brazil) Referee: Nassir Al-Enezi (Kuwait) Linesmen: Yusuf Abdullah Qambar Al-Wazeer (Bahrain) & Anan Al-Rawagh (Palestine) Fourth Official: Mahmoud Al-Jaish (Palestine) Cautions: Khalid Aziz Al-Thaker 36, Jalal Akbari Kelishadi 40, Taiseer Jaber Al-Jassam 54, Kamil Saddiq Al-Mousa 60, Jalal Akbari Kelishadi 74, Masaud Soleimani Shojaei 86, Mazyar Zare Eshghdoost 92, Mohammed Nori 95 Sending-Off: Jalal Akbari Kelishadi 74 Final Dec 10 Iraq 2-2 Syria [Sahim Bin Hamed, Qatar Sports Club Stadium, Doha] Razzaq Farhan 45, Younis Mahmoud 78; Mahmoud Amena 19, Jehad Al-Hussein 91 Iraq: Nour Sabri, Samal Saeed, Ali Hussein Rahema, Yassir Raad, Haidar Abdul-Amir, Qusai Munir, Haitham Kadhim (Ahmed Salah 64'), Wisam Zaki (Younis Mahmoud 46'), Nashat Akram, Emad Mohammed, Razzaq Farhan [c] (Haidar Abdul-Razzaq 84') Coach: Akram Salman Ahmed Syria: Mohammed Redwan Al-Azhar; Ali Diab, Abdel-Kader Dakka, Mohammed Istanbuli; Jehad Al-Hussein (Mohammed Bashar Al-Kaddour 99'), Mahmoud Amena (Fahed Oudah 103'), Majed Al-Haj, Yahya Al-Rashid (Moutasim Alaya 75'), Anas Al-Khoja; Ziyad Shaabo(c), Firas Ismail. (2 teams advance) Group 2: Saudi Arabia, UAE, Bahrain. (1 team advance) Group 3: Iraq, Oman, Iran. (1 team advance) The groups were drawn for a second time after teams complained that Group 1 which had two teams advance to the semi-finals was a group made up of weak teams. Second Draw Group 1: Qatar, Syria, Bahrain, Oman (2 teams advance) Group 2: Iraq, UAE, Iran. (1 team advance) Group 3: Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Palestine (1 team advance) The third draw was made after the UAE withdrew. The Emirates FA had expected to postpone the UAE League so a full strength national side could take part, but the UAE FA had complained that several of the teams had weak national selections, and decided against taking part.
